business.headline: Is EPF to NPS transfer possible? Check the details hereThe decision to transfer EPF to NPS must align with your financial goals, liquidity needs, and risk appetite.

8th Pay Commission: How much salary increase can government employees expect?Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the decision and said that the commission would be formed soon to revise the pay structure for central government employees and pensioners.
Will India's growth story gain momentum or slow down in FY26?India's GDP, which clocked a stellar 9.7% in FY22 before settling at 7% in FY23 and 8.2% in FY24, has been on a roller-coaster ride.

Axis Bank shares drop 6% to hit 52-week low. Should you buy? Axis Bank share price: The stock closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

8th Pay Commission: What is fitment factor that determines salary hikeThe salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay.
Reliance share price rises over 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy now? Reliance's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Explained: Why Infosys share price tumbled over 5% after strong Q3 resultsInfosys stock was down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 a.m. The company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.

Sensex drops 750 points. Why did stock market fall in early trade?Stock market down today: The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys' shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast.

Sensex drops 400 points: Markets tank as IT stocks fall; Infosys down 5%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 430.02 points to 76,612.80, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 121.05 points to 23,190.75 as of 9:22 AM.

Donald Trump plans to make cryptocurrency a national priority: ReportThe order will designate cryptocurrency as a national imperative, encouraging government agencies to collaborate with the industry.

RIL shares in focus today post Q3 results: 5 things investors need to know RIL posted a 12% year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to a record Rs 21,930 crore for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 (FY25).

8th Pay Commission: Will pensions see a big jump? Here's what you need to knowThe Union Cabinet approved the 8th Pay Commission on Thursday to revise the salaries of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision and said that the commission will likely be established soon.
8 key expectations from Budget 2025With Budget 2025 approaching, people are expecting key reforms like simpler taxes and relief for the middle class.
From tomatoes to tiramisu: India's most delivered items in 2024India's 2024 delivery trends reveal rising demand for food, fashion, and documents, as per Borzo.

Infosys Q3 Results: Net profit surges 11% to Rs 6,806 crore, revenue up 8%Infosys Q3 Results: The Bengaluru-based tech giant also revised its revenue guidance for the current fiscal year upward to 4.5%-5%, signaling optimism in its growth trajectory despite global economic uncertainties.
Sensex, Nifty close higher as PSU banks shine; global cues boost sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 318.74 points to close at 77,042.82, while the NSE Nifty50 added 98.60 points to end at 23,311.80.

8th Pay Commission formation: What it means for central government staffThe 8th Pay Commission is expected to be formed by 2026 as the 7th Pay Commission's recommendations, implemented in January 2016, conclude at the end of 2025.

Budget 2025: 5 key expectations from India's insurance sectorIndia's insurance sector expects reforms in the upcoming budget to make insurance more accessible, affordable, and innovative.





India's insurance sector anticipates reforms in the upcoming budget to make insurance more accessible, affordable, and innovative.

8th Pay Commission for central government employees approved. Check details Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision. While the Cabinet has given its approval, the date for setting up the commission has not been disclosed.

Global economy to weaken over next year, Europe braces for slowdown: WEF report While the global economy braces for subdued growth in 2025, the United States and South Asia, particularly India, emerge as bright spots in an otherwise gloomy outlook.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan walked into hospital like a tiger, escaped big spine injury: Doctors Live UpdatesDoctors said that even though Saif was in a state of shock and covered in blood, "he walked in like a tiger."

New CCTV clip shows Saif Ali Khan's attacker entering building, face coveredSaif Ali Khan attack: The intruder was again captured on the CCTV at 2.33 am climbing down the stairs calmly. This time his face was clearly visible.

Taimur, not Ibrahim, accompanied Saif Ali Khan to the hospitalActor Saif Ali Khan was taken to the hospital on Thursday after he suffered stab wounds following a burglary attempt at his house. The actor was accompanied by his son, Taimur Ali Khan to the hospital.

When a murder over a courtesan shook the Raj, toppled a raja 100 years agoThe killing of young businessman Abdul Kadir Bawla in Bombay's Malabar Hill 100 years ago, considered the most sensational murder in the British Raj, shook the empire in India. Bawla was with his companion Mumtaz Begum, a courtesan who had escaped the zenana of the princely state of Indore. The probe led to the toppling of a king.

Emergency review: Kangana Ranaut delivers a rushed crash course on Indira GandhiReleased-Fri Jan 17, 2025Emergency movie review: Kangana Ranaut's film Emergency briefly touches on the 1975 Emergency while attempting to provide a crash course on Indira Gandhi's life, but struggles to delve deeply into key historical events and character motivations.

Supreme Court pauses order directing rollout of Ayushman Bharat scheme in DelhiThe Supreme Court has paused a Delhi High Court order that directed the Delhi government to sign an agreement with the Centre for the rollout of Ayushman Bharat scheme in the national capital.

Michelle Obama opts out of Trump swearing-in. 'Divorce' has nothing to do with itFormer First Lady Michelle Obama won't be attending Donald Trump's inauguration. It echoes a previous break with tradition when Trump refused to attend Joe Biden's swearing-in over baseless claims that the presidential election was stolen.

Saif Ali Khan attacker recced Shah Rukh Khan's house, cops suspect: SourcesSaif Ali Khan attack: The CCTV footage recovered from Shah Rukh Khan's house showed that the person's height and build closely resembles the suspect seen in the footage obtained from Saif's flat.

Paatal Lok 2 review: Jaideep Ahlawat show enters a risky, unexplored territoryReleased-Fri Jan 17, 2025Paatal Lok 2 review: Jaideep Ahlawat returns as Hathi Ram Chaudhary after five years with the second season of Paatal Lok. While the rawness and murkiness are restrained, the season ventures into some risky territory. Read the full review here.

Day 6 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff off to strong starts in 3rd roundAustralian Open 2025 Day 6 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic is up against 26th seed Tomas Machac while Coco Gauff is taking on Leylah Fernandez in an exciting third-round battle. It was heartbreak for Naomi Osaka as she was forced to retire after an injury and forfeit her match against Bencic. Osaka had lost the first set in an intense tiebreaker before injury struck. Carlos Alcaraz overcame the Nuno Borges test in 4 sets to progress to the next round of the Australian Open. Alexander Zverev, on the other hand, dominated the UK's Jacob Fearnley to book his spot in the next round as well. Naomi Osaka's third round clash against Bencic is underway. Earlier, Aryna Sabalenka and Rohan Bopanna won their respective matches.

Zuckerberg blamed Sheryl Sandberg for Meta's culture in Trump meeting: ReportThe report comes as Meta, which owns platforms like Facebook and Instagram, announced that it was ending its fact-checking and its diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) programs.

Watch: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh receive Khel Ratna award from PresidentOlympic medallists Manu Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh, Paralympian Praveen Kumar and world chess champion D Gukesh recieved the Khel Ratna Award, India's highest sporting honour, from President Droupadi Murmu on National Sports Day.

Elon Musk lost a spacecraft, Jeff Bezos' rocket crashedThe two tech titans, known to be at loggerheads, seem to be warming up to each other thanks to their rocketry journey with SpaceX and Blue Origin.

Andhra Pradesh couple hosts 630-dish feast for son-in-law's first SankrantiIn a grand gesture, a couple from Andhra Pradesh hosted a feast with 630 dishes for their son-in-law on their first Sankranti festival after marriage. Similarly, another couple from Yanam, Puducherry, prepared a dinner with 470 varieties for their son-in-law.

INDIA group is dead, Delhi election will drive last nail into coffinThe INDIA alliance is almost dead, and only the last rites need to be performed, most likely once the high-stakes Delhi assembly elections are done and dusted.

Who attacked Saif Ali Khan? SRK home recce link, CCTV, Rs 1 crore demand: 5 factsThe Mumbai Police detained a suspect on Thursday in connection with the attack on actor Saif Ali Khan during a burglary attempt in his Bandra apartment.

'Bring your own chips' is now viral in India. But health experts have a warningThe BYOC (Bring Your Own Chips) trend is sweeping across several Indian cities, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Surat. Premium restaurants as well as street food vendors are embracing it.

Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan gets 14 years in jail in £190 million land corruption casePakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan was sentenced to 14 years in prison, and his wife Bushra Bibi to seven years in a corruption case involving the Al-Qadir University Project Trust.

Microsoft's one-word reply with heart emoji to 'shut Teams instead of TikTok' postIt all started with the question posed by the X account 'memes.xlsx' to Microsoft 365: "Can they shut down Teams instead of TikTok?"

Suspect detained, several others questioned in Saif Ali Khan attack case: Sources Live UpdatesMumbai Police have detained one suspect in connection with an attack on Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan in his home in the city's Bandra area. As many as 20 teams were formed by the Mumbai Police to arrest the suspect in the case.

Zomato CEO introduces 'wellness facility' for employees at Gurugram headquartersDeepinder Goyal emphasised that Zomato places a strong focus on fostering a supportive and health-conscious work environment, offering an impressive range of wellness benefits and facilities to its employees.

Made-in-China dog chews linked to 'werewolf syndrome'The UK's Food Standards Agency has cautioned dog owners against feeding their pets certain chews imported from China due to concerns over 'werewolf syndrome'.

Pushpa 2 reloaded: Allu Arjun's film releases with 20-minutes extra footageAllu Arjun's Pushpa 2 grossed over Rs 1,800 crore worldwide and is still running successfully in many theatres. A new version of the film with 20-minutes additional footage will be played in theatres from January 17.

Complete harassment: Kangana Ranaut on people seeking ban on Emergency in Punjab Actor Kangana Ranaut reacted to Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee's (SGPC) protests against screening her film Emergency in Punjab. She shared a note on X calling the move 'complete harassment'.

BB 18 Day 101: Avinash Mishra, Karan Veer Mehra relive their journeyWith the grand finale of Bigg Boss 18 approaching, finalists got to relive their 15-week journey inside the house, highlighting key moments and personal transformations.

Ibrahim's Diler shoot put on hold after Saif Ali Khan's attack Saif Ali Khan's son, Ibrahim Ali Khan, has postponed his shoot of Diler to be with his father during this difficult time. Khan was attacked on January 16 during a burglary attempt at his Bandra residence.

Meanwhile, two-time champion Naomi Osaka retired midway through her third-round match due to an injury on Friday, January 17.

Women's Ashes: Gardner, King shine as Australia sweep England in ODIs, take 6-0 leadAshleigh Gardner's maiden hundred and Alana King's 5-wicket haul helped Australia defeat England by 86 runs to win the 3rd ODI and sweep the series on Friday, January 17. Australia have taken a 6-0 lead in the Women's Ashes as England hope to hang by a thread.

PAK vs WI: No rain, but dense fog delays start of play in Multan Test matchPakistan vs West Indies, 1st Test: The first session on Day 1 of the series opener was washed out due to dense fog in Multan. The toss was delayed due to poor visibility at the Multan Cricket Stadium on Friday, January 17.

Aakash Chopra provides simple solution to leaks in Indian cricketThe Indian cricket team has been plagued with multiple leaks in the past two months. As confidential BCCI updates continue to be reported by the media, Aakash Chopra has has found a unique solution to the problem.

Shriver had stored the trophies in her car, which got stolen from the front of a hotel.

Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya practice together before Champions TrophyRohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya were seen practising together in Mumbai. The duo were seen in Mumbai Indians' nets just days out of the white-ball series against England.

Will take the game to next level: Gukesh backs chess in Olympics Indian chess prodigy D Gukesh has voiced his strong support for chess to be included in the Olympic Games, highlighting how such a move would elevate the game to new heights.

Tushar likely to remain sidelined for next 2-3 months due to ankle injuryMumbai pacer Tushar Deshpande faces an extended recovery period after his ankle injury resurfaced, sidelining him for another two to three months. Meanwhile, Yashasvi Jaiswal gears up for the Ranji Trophy clash against Jammu and Kashmir, following a mixed performance in Australia's tour.

Karun Nair stars to help Vidarbha set up final vs KarnatakaVidarbha defeated Maharashtra by 69 runs in the second semi-final of the Vijay Hazare Trophy to set up a mouth-watering title clash against Karnataka on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
